sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the S&P 500 index, there is noteworthy activity today in General Electric Co (Symbol: GE), where a total volume of 357,579 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 35.8 million underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 42.5% of GE's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 84.2 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $13 strike put option expiring January 18, 2019 , with 50,138 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 5.0 million underlying shares of GE.

Below is a chart showing GE's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $13 strike highlighted in orange:

TJX Companies (Symbol: TJX) saw options trading volume of 19,368 contracts, representing approximately 1.9 million underlying shares or approximately 41.7% of TJX's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 4.6 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $80 strike call option expiring March 16, 2018 , with 6,620 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 662,000 underlying shares of TJX.

Below is a chart showing TJX's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $80 strike highlighted in orange:

And Salesforce.com Inc (Symbol: CRM) options are showing a volume of 21,468 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 2.1 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 40.7% of CRM's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 5.3 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $115 strike call option expiring March 16, 2018 , with 746 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 74,600 underlying shares of CRM.

Below is a chart showing CRM's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $115 strike highlighted in orange:
